page.title: 03HOUSING IN W.G.C.
page.content: In {1920}the first houses in {WGC. were built on the Broadwater Estate. These concrete houses were designed by {Louis de Soissons.}Each house had sash windows and Roman tiles.These terraced houses are now being replaced with modern brick built houses which retain the design originally proposed by{ {Louis de Soissons.}There are 2000 houses in this block most of which are terraced.The newest houses are built on the site of the {Mater Dei Convent} and have Georgian sash windows and Roman tiles.These features are similar to houses in Letchworth another garden city designed by{Ebenezer Howard & {Louis de Soissons.} Aerials are allowed if they are not obtrusive,loft aerials are encouraged.
